availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Charles C. Eaves (Greenville and Henderson attorney)

body.p: Greenville, Kentucky, and Henderson, Kentucky, attorney. Muhlenberg County, Kentucky, native. Married Martha G. Beech Eaves in 1852. Father of Frances Eaves and Charles P. Eaves. Admitted to the bar in 1846. Member of the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from 1857 to 1859. Attorney in Muhlenberg County in 1850. Attorney in Henderson in 1860.

bibl.p: Otto A. Rothert, A History of Muhlenberg County (Louisville, KY: John P. Morton and Company, 1913), p. 242-244. John Livingston, Livingstonâ€™s United States Law Register, and Official Directory (New York: John A. Gray, 1859), p. 304. Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Muhlenberg County, District 1, p. 222. Jordan Dodd, Kentucky Marriages, 1802-1850, Muhlenberg County, 1852. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Muhlenberg County, Greenville, District 2, p. 42. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Henderson County, Henderson, Ward 3, p. 28. Twelfth Manuscript Census of the United States (1900), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Muhlenberg County, Greenville City, ED 70.
